ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: one hour

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The course was a great exposure to a variety of people in health policy and potential career paths in policy

This course was a great opportunity to hear about the different kinds of work that can be done in health policy. The speakers were all incredibly interesting and very excited about engaging with students. Shelley worked hard to make sure the topics were related to things we were interested in.
This was a wonderful seminar! I wish we had more meetings because each lecture and guest was incredibly engaging and interesting.
AWESOME SPEAKERS. They all really appreciated feedback / dialogue in an inspiring way and made me inspired to work in this field. Very high quality learning experience and I'm glad I took the class.
good but felt more like a chore than it felt helpful. should have been voluntary
Great seminar, cool speakers; it's required but actually pretty enjoyable PLUS dinner is provided
I loved the variety of speakers and the fact that they focused on career development!

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley was great at coordinating the speakers and listening to feedback about the speakers and food we were interested in hearing.

Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley was very thoughtful about making sure the speakers were covering topics we were interested in. She asked for our recommendations and feedback at the beginning, middle, and end of the course. She also helped guide discussion during the sessions.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley is great. She is clearly committed to teaching and to student growth.

Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Professor Geballe works hard to get speakers that match our interests and I appreciated her attention to that, as well as her attendance to all speaker events and asking questions sometimes of the speakers.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  maybe put presentations in a room where the instructor would feel more important. the presentations felt like they were shoved in a side-room
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Amazing instructor who really responds to feedback! We are lucky to have Shelley!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The corse is comprised by a series of guest lectures given by individuals working in health policy. It was a great experience and a great way to be exposed to a variety of potential career paths and problems within policy to think about.
I would definitely recommend this. Very interesting speakers and a great opportunity to get perspective about working in health policy.
I would recommend this to anyone!
Great! Awesome speakers! Would recommend taking the class even if you're not a health policy student. Great experience.
interesting presentations from healthcare professionals
This is the perfect course to understand all the different career paths you could take with an MPH in Health Policy.
